citeinfo.origin: National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA), Office of Oceanic and Atmospheric Research (OAR), Pacific Marine Environmental Laboratory (PMEL)
citeinfo.title: Moored Buoy Data for the Bering Sea (1975-82)

descript.abstract: Bering Sea fixed buoy data were collected by NOAA's Pacific Marine Environmental Laboratory from September 1975 to July 1982 under the direction of Dr. James Schumacher. These data consist of 43 files, where each file represents a single buoy mooring and many contain one or more of the following parameters: air and sea pressure; sea temperature; salinity; and current components. These files are recorded on a 9-track, 1600 BPI magnetic tape in ASCII code. NOAAServer Codes: [L 65 55 -165 -180] ; nodateline.
descript.purpose: This study was part of the Bureau of Land Management's Ocean Continental Environmental Assessment Program (OSCEAP).

idinfo.useconst: If used in publication, cite source.

NOAA makes no warranty, expressed or implied, nor does the fact of distribution constitute such a warranty.
